text: This is a list of Columbus Blue Jackets award winners. ==League awards== ===Team trophies=== The Columbus Blue Jackets have not won any of the team trophies the National Hockey League (NHL) awards annually — the Stanley Cup as league champions, the Prince of Wales Trophy as Eastern Conference playoff champions and the Presidents' Trophy as the team with the most regular season points. ===Individual awards=== {| class="wikitable sortable" width="75%" |+Individual awards won by Columbus Blue Jackets players and staffColumbus Blue Jackets 2014–2015 Media Guide, p.299 ! scope="col" |Award ! scope="col" class="unsortable" |Description ! scope="col" |Winner ! scope="col" |Season ! scope="col" class="unsortable" |References |- ! scope="row" | Calder Memorial Trophy | Rookie of the year | || | |- ! scope="row" | Jack Adams Award | Best coach | || | |- ! scope="row" | King Clancy Memorial Trophy | Leadership / Humanitarian | || | |- ! scope="row" | Mark Messier Leadership Award | Leadership | || | |- ! scope="row" | Maurice "Rocket" Richard Trophy | Most goals in the regular season | || | |- ! scope="row" |NHL Foundation Player Award |Community service | || | |- ! scope="row" rowspan="2" | Vezina Trophy | rowspan="2" |Top goaltender |rowspan="2" | || |rowspan="2" | |- | |} ==All- Stars== ===NHL First and Second Team All-Stars=== The NHL First and Second Team All-Stars consists of the top players at each position as voted on by the Professional Hockey Writers' Association. {| class="wikitable sortable" width="75%" |+ Columbus Blue Jackets selected to the NHL First and Second Team All-Stars ! scope="col" |Player ! scope="col" |Position ! scope="col" |Selections ! scope="col" |Season ! scope="col" |Team |- ! scope="row" rowspan="2" | |rowspan="2" | |rowspan="2" |2 | |1st |- | |1st |- ! scope="row" | | |1 | |2nd |- ! scope="row" | | |1 | |2nd |} ===NHL All-Rookie Team=== The NHL All-Rookie Team consists of the top rookies at each position as voted on by the Professional Hockey Writers' Association.2014–15 NHL Official Guide & Record Book, p. 233 {| class="wikitable sortable" width="75%" |+ Columbus Blue Jackets selected to the NHL All-Rookie Team ! scope="col" |Player ! scope="col" |Position ! scope="col" |Season |- ! scope="row" | | | |- ! scope="row" | | | |- ! scope="row" | | | |- ! scope="row" | | | |- ! scope="row" | | | |} ===All-Star Game selections=== The National Hockey League All-Star Game is a mid-season exhibition game held annually between many of the top players of each season. Fourteen All-Star Games have been held since the Columbus Blue Jackets entered the league in 2000, with at least one player chosen to represent the Blue Jackets in each year except 2001 and 2012. The All-Star game has not been held in various years: 1979 and 1987 due to the 1979 Challenge Cup and Rendez-vous '87 series between the NHL and the Soviet national team, respectively, 1995, 2005, and 2013 as a result of labor stoppages, and 2006, 2010, and 2014 because of the Winter Olympic Games. Columbus has hosted one of the games. The 60th took place at Nationwide Arena. * All-Star Game Most Valuable Player2014–15 NHL Official Guide & Record Book, p. 234 {| class="wikitable sortable" width="75%" |+Columbus Blue Jackets players and coaches selected to the All-Star Game |- !scope="col" | Game !scope="col" | Year !scope="col" | Name !scope="col" | Position !scope="col" class="unsortable"| References |- ! scope="row" | 51st |2001 |No Blue Jackets selected |— | |- ! scope="row" | 52nd |2002 | | | |- ! scope="row" | 53rd |2003 | | | |- ! scope="row" | 54th |2004 | | | |- ! scope="row" | 55th |2007 | | | |- ! scope="row" | 56th |2008 | | | |- ! scope="row" | 57th |2009 | | | |- ! scope="row" | 58th |2011 | | | |- ! scope="row" | 59th |2012 |No Blue Jackets selected |— | |- ! scope="row" rowspan="3" | 60th |rowspan="3" |2015 | (Did not play) | |rowspan="3" | |- | | |- | | |- ! scope="row" | 61st |2016 | | | |- ! scope="row" rowspan="4" | 62nd |rowspan="4" |2017 | (Replaced Evgeni Malkin) | |rowspan="4" | |- | | |- | | |- | | |- ! scope="row" rowspan="2" | 63rd |rowspan="2" |2018 | (Did not play) | |rowspan="2" | |- | (Replaced Jones) | |- ! scope="row" rowspan="2" | 64th |rowspan="2" |2019 | | |rowspan="2" | |- | | |- ! scope="row" rowspan="2" | 65th |rowspan="2" |2020 | | |rowspan="2" | |- | (Did not play) | |} ==Career achievements== ===Hockey Hall of Fame=== The following is a list of Columbus Blue Jackets who have been enshrined in the Hockey Hall of Fame. {| class="wikitable sortable" width="75%" |+Columbus Blue Jackets inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame ! scope="col" |Individual ! scope="col" |Category ! scope="col" |Year inducted ! scope="col" |Years with Blue Jackets in category ! scope="col" class="unsortable" |References |- ! scope="row" | |Player |2015 |2005–2008 |, retrieved November 10, 2015 |} ===Retired numbers=== The Columbus Blue Jackets have not retired any of their jersey numbers. Out of circulation is the number 99 which was retired league-wide for Wayne Gretzky on February 6, 2000. ==Team awards== ===Columbus Blue Jackets Foundation Community Service Award=== The Columbus Blue Jackets Foundation Community Service Award is an annual award given to the player "who went above and beyond off the ice in support of charitable initiatives benefiting those in need throughout the community" as determined by the Blue Jackets Foundation and community development staff.Columbus Blue Jackets 2014–2015 Media Guide, p.301 {| class="wikitable" ! scope="col" style="width:5em"|Season ! scope="col" style="width:15em"|Winner |- ! scope="row"| 2002–03 | Tyler Wright |- ! scope="row"| 2003–04 | Luke Richardson |- ! scope="row"| 2005–06 | Manny Malhotra |- ! scope="row"| 2006–07 | Jody Shelley |- ! scope="row"| 2007–08 | Dan Fritsche |- ! scope="row"| 2008–09 | Rick Nash |} {| class="wikitable" ! scope="col" style="width:5em"|Season ! scope="col" style="width:15em"|Winner |- ! scope="row"| 2009–10 | R. J. Umberger |- ! scope="row"| 2010–11 | Jared Boll |- ! scope="row"| 2011–12 | Marc Methot |- ! scope="row"| 2012–13 | Derek MacKenzie |- ! scope="row"| 2013–14 | Derek MacKenzie |- ! scope="row"| 2014–15 | Nick Foligno |} {| class="wikitable" ! scope="col" style="width:5em"|Season ! scope="col" style="width:15em"|Winner |- ! scope="row"| 2015–16 | David Clarkson |- ! scope="row"| 2016–17 | Nick Foligno |- ! scope="row"| 2017–18 | Sergei Bobrovsky |- ! scope="row"| 2018–19 | Nick Foligno |} ==="Jackets Fans" Most Valuable Player Award=== The "Jackets Fans" Most Valuable Player Award is an annual award given to the team's Most Valuable Player as determined by the fans. {| class="wikitable" ! scope="col" style="width:5em"|Season ! scope="col" style="width:15em"|Winner |- ! scope="row"| 2006–07 | Fredrik Norrena |- ! scope="row"| 2007–08 | Rick Nash |- ! scope="row"| 2008–09 | Steve Mason |- ! scope="row"| 2009–10 | Rick Nash |} {| class="wikitable" ! scope="col" style="width:5em"|Season ! scope="col" style="width:15em"|Winner |- ! scope="row"| 2010–11 | R. J. Umberger |- ! scope="row"| 2011–12 | Derek Dorsett |- ! scope="row"| 2012–13 | Sergei Bobrovsky |- ! scope="row"| 2013–14 | Ryan Johansen |} {| class="wikitable" ! scope="col" style="width:5em"|Season ! scope="col" style="width:15em"|Winner |- ! scope="row"| 2014–15 | Nick Foligno |- ! scope="row"| 2015–16 | Boone Jenner |- ! scope="row"| 2016–17 | Sergei Bobrovsky |- ! scope="row"| 2017–18 | Artemi Panarin |} ==="John H. McConnell" Most Courageous Player Award=== The "John H. McConnell" Most Courageous Player Award is an annual award given to the player who "day in and day out exhibited hard work, dedication and a willingness to overcome obstacles in his commitment to the team" as determined by Blue Jackets players. {| class="wikitable" ! scope="col" style="width:5em"|Season ! scope="col" style="width:15em"|Winner |- ! scope="row"| 2006–07 | Fredrik Modin |- ! scope="row"| 2007–08 | Rick Nash |- ! scope="row"| 2008–09 | Andrew Murray |- ! scope="row"| 2009–10 | Jared Boll |} {| class="wikitable" ! scope="col" style="width:5em"|Season ! scope="col" style="width:15em"|Winner |- ! scope="row"| 2010–11 | R. J. Umberger |- ! scope="row"| 2011–12 | Derek Dorsett |- ! scope="row"| 2012–13 | Sergei Bobrovsky |- ! scope="row"| 2013–14 | Derek MacKenzie |} {| class="wikitable" ! scope="col" style="width:5em"|Season ! scope="col" style="width:15em"|Winner |- ! scope="row"| 2014–15 | Sergei Bobrovsky |- ! scope="row"| 2015–16 | Boone Jenner |- ! scope="row"| 2016–17 | Sergei Bobrovsky |- ! scope="row"| 2017–18 | Seth Jones |} ===Most Improved Player Award=== The Most Improved Player Award is an annual award given to the player "deemed to have improved the most during the course of the regular season" as determined by the team's television and radio broadcasters. {| class="wikitable" ! scope="col" style="width:5em"|Season ! scope="col" style="width:15em"|Winner |- ! scope="row"| 2006–07 | Ole-Kristian Tollefsen |- ! scope="row"| 2007–08 | Pascal Leclaire |- ! scope="row"| 2008–09 | Marc Methot |- ! scope="row"| 2015–16 | Boone Jenner |- ! scope="row"| 2016–17 | Alexander Wennberg |- ! scope="row"| 2017–18 | Seth Jones |} ===Outstanding Defenseman Award=== The Outstanding Defenseman Award is given the team's top defenseman as determined by members of the local media. {| class="wikitable" ! scope="col" style="width:5em"|Season ! scope="col" style="width:15em"|Winner |- ! scope="row"| 2006–07 | Rostislav Klesla |- ! scope="row"| 2007–08 | Jan Hejda |- ! scope="row"| 2008–09 | Jan Hejda |- ! scope="row"| 2015–16 | Ryan Murray |- ! scope="row"| 2016–17 | Seth Jones |- ! scope="row"| 2017–18 | Seth Jones |} ===Three Stars Award=== The Three Stars Award is an annual award given to the player who earns the most points from Star of the Game selections throughout the regular season. {| class="wikitable" !
